title: PHPob_flush()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPob_flush()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Output the contents of a buffer without deleting it:
<?php
ob_start();
echo "This output will be sent to the browser";
ob_flush();
echo "This output will not be sent to the browser";
ob_end_clean();
?>

Definition and Usage
The
ob_flush()
function outputs the contents of the topmost output buffer and then clears
the buffer of the contents. The output may be caught by another output buffer or, if there
are no other output buffers, sent directly to the browser.
Syntax
ob_flush();
Technical Details
PHP Version:
4.2+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPob_flush()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPob_flush()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPob_flush()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
